column2: Which one is correct?
There's no hope.
There isn't any hope.
There is no hope.
You'll never leave this town.
What is "man"?
Five times five is twenty-five.
The horse has four feet.
Let no one lightly discuss the subject of rites.
Stability is in unity.
When unlike is joined to unlike, the result is called harmony.
Try to explain this.
What is that noise?
Don't be hasty.
Good medicine tastes bitter, good advice is hard to listen to.
column4: 良藥苦於口，忠言逆於耳。

column2: What one cannot see is what is distant; instead, look at what is near.
I don't know what more I can say.
Heaven and Earth are like the wheel of a cart: ending then beginning anew, reaching their extremes they turn back again, - nothing is ever out of place.
column4: 天地車輪，終則復始，極則復反，莫不咸當。

column2: Complete enumeration of the different parts of a carriage does not make a carriage.
Who is content Needs fear no shame. Who knows to stop Incurs no blame. From danger free Long live shall he.
column4: 知足不辱，知止不殆，可以長久。

column2: Do thou what's straight still crooked deem; Thy greatest art still stupid seem, And eloquence a stammering scream.
column4: 大直若屈，大巧若拙，大辯若訥。

column2: I know it's none of my business.
Intense admiration comes with a hefty price.
Thou art That.
Mencius said, 'A great man is the one who does not lose his heart of a child.'
column4: 孟子曰：「大人者，不失其赤子之心者也。」

column2: The great one always has a pure heart.
column4: 孟子曰：「大人者，不失其赤子之心者也。」

column2: A cart with four horses is not able to overtake the human tongue.
Those who know won't say, and those who will don't know.
Better tools make good work.
column4: 工欲善其事，必先利其器。

column2: Five times five is twenty five.
Nothing good will come out of this.
Learning without thought is labor lost; thought without learning is perilous.
column4: 學而不思則罔，思而不學則殆。

column2: When a country is well governed, poverty and a mean condition are things to be ashamed of. When a country is ill governed, riches and honor are things to be ashamed of.
column4: 邦有道，貧且賤焉，恥也；邦無道，富且貴焉，恥也。

column2: Where is this mentioned in the scriptures?
Why is it so?
How do we draw this conclusion?
I am very busy.
There is learning in suffering.
One day without reading makes the mouth grow thorns within.
column4: 一日不讀書口中生荊棘。

column2: When Qi follows the Way, there is life. When there is life, there is thought. When there is thought, there is knowledge. When there is knowledge, one stops. In all cases, the forms of the mind are such that transgressive knowledge leads to a loss of life.
column4: 氣道乃生，生乃思，思乃知，知乃止矣。凡心之形，過知失生。

column2: The superior man controls things, he is not controlled by them.
Of yore, when Confucius passed away, his subtle words were cut off, and when his seventy disciples died the transmission of their profound meaning diverged.
column4: 昔仲尼沒而微言闕，七十子喪而大義乖。

column2: There are four seasons to Heaven: spring, autumn, winter and summer. Winds, rains, hoarfrost and dew - none of them is bereft of educational implications.
column4: 天有四時，春秋冬夏，風雨霜露，無非教也。

column2: Confucius said: "To see the dead person to his grave with the thought that he is unmistakably dead is inhuman and not something one should do. To see the dead person to his grave with the thought that he is still alive is unwise and also not something one should do."
column4: 孔子曰：「之死而致死之，不仁而不可為也；之死而致生之，不知而不可為也。」

column2: Wisdom was not created from books, but books were created from wisdom.
column4: 非以書而立智，先智而後書也。

column2: Wisdom was not created from books, but books were created from wisdom.
column4: 智非出於書，書者，智之出也。

column2: Wisdom was not created from books, but books were created from wisdom.
column4: 智非出於書，書乃出於智。

column2: Easier said than done.
Man is water.
Dao is like a broad road, is it difficult to discover? The problem is that people are not looking for it. If you return to the search, you will find plenty of teachers.
column4: 夫道，若大路然，豈難知哉？人病不求耳。子歸而求之，有餘師。

column2: In the practice of the Great Way, all under Heaven was public.
Rotten wood cannot be carved; walls of dung cannot be worked with a trowel.
column4: 朽木不可雕也，糞土之牆不可杇也。

column2: Let alone the criminals: They have suffered for their offences; But those who have no crime, Are indiscriminately involved in ruin.
column4: 舍彼有罪、既伏其辜。 若此無罪、淪胥以鋪。

column2: I don't know what it means.
I don't know what it means.
Water reflects light.
My wife is obsessed with cleaning.
It's a chick thing.
In for a penny, in for a pound.
There is no shortcut to education.
Yes, Sir!
I don't have a penny to my name.
Good always wins over evil.
Bad thoughts give birth to bad actions.
I'm now unarmed.
Karate is an art of unarmed defense.
column4: 空手道者非戎之武藝也。

column2: Those who know do not talk. Those who talk do not know.
Man dies for the sake of the one who recognizes his worth.
This is the reason why I came here.
The Master said, "If a man be without the virtues proper to humanity, what has he to do with the rites of propriety? If a man be without the virtues proper to humanity, what has he to do with music?"
column4: 子曰：「人而不仁，如禮何？人而不仁，如樂何？」

column2: Is he not a man of complete virtue, who feels no discomposure though men may take no note of him?
column4: 人不知而不慍，不亦君子乎？

column2: The superior man bends his attention to what is radical. That being established, all practical courses naturally grow up.
Help yourself and God will help you.
God helps those who help themselves.
Every action has its consequence.
The number of grains of sand on a beach is calculable.
What is luck?
You're mistaken.
You are mistaken!
When internal examination discovers nothing wrong, what is there to be anxious about, what is there to fear?
No.
Do you know this thing?
No.
There are many earthquakes in Japan.
There are a lot of earthquakes in Japan.
I have no idea.
I don't know.
I've no idea.
I do not know.
What more could I ask for?
Don't hesitate to speak just because I am your elder.
column4: 以吾一日長乎爾，毋吾以也!

column2: That's a real strongman, bestow upon him a goblet of wine!
Shattered bones and crushed flesh won't cancel your debts. One word of insight is worth ten million words of apology.
column4: 粉骨碎身未足酬。一句了然超百億。

column2: Later people will look upon us of the present just as we of the present look upon those in the past.
column4: 後之視今亦猶今之視昔。

column2: What?
The sun comes up in the east and goes down in the west.
column4: 日出於東方而落於西方也。

column2: Achievement is founded on diligence and wasted upon recklessness.

Heaven and earth exhibit no benevolence; to them the ten thousand things are like straw dogs. The holy man exhibits no benevolence; to him the hundred families are like straw dogs. Is not the space between heaven and earth like unto a bellows? It is empty; yet it collapses not. It moves, and more and more comes forth.
column4: 天地不仁，以萬物為芻狗；聖人不仁，以百姓為芻狗。天地之閒其猶橐籥乎？虛而不屈，動而愈出。

column2: The Reason that can be reasoned is not the eternal Reason. The name that can be named is not the eternal name. The Unnameable is of heaven and earth the beginning. The Nameable becomes of the ten thousand things the mother.
column4: 道可道，非恆道；名可名，非恆名。無名天地之始；有名萬物之母。
